AUTHOR: benoit coeure
TITLE: BENOIT COEURE, EXECUTIVE BOARD MEMBER, ECB IS INTERVIEWED ON BLOOMBERG TV
TEXT: MARK BARTON, HOST, BLOOMBERG NEWS: We're not going to rush. That's the message from one of the key figures at the European Central Bank. Speaking exclusively to Bloomberg, executive board member Benoit Coeure says the ECB will look at all the options on trying to stimulate Europe's economies by buying new assets. He told Francine Lacqua that asset purchases would be up for discussion at the bank's December meeting. (VIDEO PLAYING) BENOIT COEURE, EXECUTIVE BOARD MEMBER, ECB: We are ready to do more if needed, so we'll be watching the situation extremely carefully. We'll be discussing it, in particular when we meet next in December. And there is unanimous agreement in the governing council that there might be situations where we would have to do more. FRANCINE LACQUA, HOST, BLOOMBERG NEWS: But the market's interpretation is actually now you feel much more comfortable in doing more than you did just four weeks ago. Is that fair? COEURE: Anything we do will remain dependent on the - on the data. We have to watch the economy very carefully. We have to understand how - what we've already decided works. We're not going to rush to a new decision without knowing whether what we've decided works. We have to look at the data around us and we have to discuss thoroughly all possible options, in particular when it come to - when it comes to buying new assets. And we want to have that discussion in December. LACQUA: What about the TLTROs? So far they've been a disappointment. How much does that actually come into your thinking? COEURE: It is an important part of our tool box. It - we are convinced that it will be extremely helpful for banks to be in a position to lend again to the real economy, and we expect this interest of banks to materialize in December when they come for the second installment of the TLTRO. I certainly expect it to be more substantial, larger than the first installment in September. LACQUA: How much of a chance is there that the ECB will do more in December, or will you wait for that TLTRO number to come in? COEURE: We'll - we'll have a discussion December. We'll look at the numbers. We'll look at how the economy is doing, and we'll look at what we've been able to achieve on the ABS market which has just started (ph) a couple of days ago and on the covered bond market, and we'll have that discussion. And if it's not in December, it will be later. We'll not let - we're not committing to any particular timeline. We want to be based on facts on what we see in the economy.
